definition: see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]

sentences.english: Tom moved toward the strang sounds with his heart in his mouth .
sentences.chinese: 湯姆心驚膽顫地走近那奇怪的聲音。

sentences.english: It was terrifying for us, as we were shaken by the waves.
sentences.chinese: 巨浪拍打在我們的身上，把我們嚇得心驚膽顫。

sentences.english: The survivors lay on the beach, exhausted and shocked.
sentences.chinese: 倖存者躺在海岸上，疲憊不堪，心驚膽顫。

definition: to return something to its rightful owner
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
trivial matter/a piece of cake
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
grand dreams/unrealistic ideas (idiom)
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
masquerade
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to play golf
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
dejected/despondent/depressed
doddering/senile
protective coloration/camouflage
to whisper to one another's ear
